page.title: 13STREET NAMES, HOCKLIFFE
page.content: Many road names are informative telling us to which{village}or{town} they are leading, e.g.{Woburn}Road, {Tebworth}Road,{Leighton}Road and {Hockliffe}Road. Others have interesting origins. {Manor Close}gets its name from the old manor which once stood there. The most recent street,{Hockley Court,}was given its name because the old name for Hockliffe was{Hockley in the Hole. {Goose Green Lane}leads up to the green and was so called because geese used to be kept there.{Whitehorse Close}is named after the{Old White Horse Inn that still stands and now sells old timbers and antique fireplaces. The {A5,}also known as{Watling Street,}is an old{Roman Road}and runs through Hockliffe. It is sometimes called {Chester Road,}since it runs from {London (Londinium)}to{Chester (Deva).
